website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's latest Fire HD 8 tablet is a great value for media consumption, as long as you can live without access to Google Play.
cons: No native Google apps or services

customer_reviews.title: 8" hd fire tablet
customer_reviews.text: I like this tablet very much it has its pride and place just below my TV, ihave it in show mode Alexa gives me news briefs , weather reports, plays all my music, films and much much more I strongly recommend this tablet can't get better at this price it has solved all my problems as I'm disabled and now all I need to do is speak to Alexa and just like magic she does it ( shame she can't wash dishes ) but yes top marks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: paul tumber

customer_reviews.title: Sadly not going to be my 3rd Amazon Fire
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this tablet as I've had a 2012 Fire 7 and a 2014 Fire HD 7. Sadly the resolution being the same on the HD8 but on a bigger screen resulted in a fuzzy image compared to the HD7. Performance wasn't much better and the screen was much more reflective. So much so that the reflection and fuzzy edges to text gave me a headache when I used it. I've returned it as a result.
customer_reviews.author: M. Warner

customer_reviews.title: No good as a Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is OK but I bought it to use as an Echo Show, when docked the screen changes to Show Mode but it soon times out to a dark screen showing the clock which is not visible in daylight. It is supposed to wake up on detecting motion but it does not. As a Echo Show it is useless. Also the volume is extremely low. I can not recommend this as a Echo Show alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first amazon tablet and i am very impressed, easy to use & setup, camera quality is okay, easy to music and video’s onto and good quality when watching back, for £80 i think this is a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Total junk - a scam, don’t buy, the purchase i most regret in life
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst purchase of my entire life. Just a scam. It’s impossible to add subscriptions to magazines you already have to this product. It basically tries to force you to buy all your subscriptions through amazon. It’s not good enough to use as a multi media device & they won’t let you download apps or transfer magazine subscriptions. You are locked into buying everything through amazon. In its gone in the bin & the money written off.. It’s junk. Definitely the worst purchase of my adult life & will never buy another amazon made product as long as I live. DO NOT BUY ONE OF THESE UNLESS YOU ARE PREPARED TO BUY EVERYTHING THROUGH AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: max sheppard

customer_reviews.title: So upset I love Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I gave the kindle 8 five stars when I first had it, but now I realise it's not mine, it's controlled by Amazon if you try to download something you get it blocked, you can only have what they say. On kindle 7 I could download anything. This will probably not reach you.......
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Richard

customer_reviews.title: Kindle fire hd 8
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th kindle and have to say this kindle is the perfect size my others had 7inch screens excellent kindles but just going up to a 8inch screen works well for me . I had a Samsung tab e with a 9.6 inch screen found it was very slow and no where near as resoonsive than my kindle. Not to bothered about the memory size as I purchased a 32g sd card which was very easy to set up. Highly recommended if your gonna buy a tablet then go for a kindle also I payed £49.99 around the Black Friday time a saving of around £50 so didn’t break the bank for me just before Xmas lol
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Ruth White

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do e.mail's.
customer_reviews.text: The email app did not work. I contacted Amazon who tried to fix it remotely and in the process I have had my hotmail account blocked. I am now unable to recover it. Lost all my contact addresses. Not at all happy.
customer_reviews.author: MRS D C MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set up for children and no app available (Mathletics)
customer_reviews.text: Received 2 Fire today (one for each of my 9 years old boys). Tried to setup children account for both that showed not simple. So far couldn’t make it work with Mathletics that was my primary target. Even worse, the app is not available for kindle. I hope this may change but so far I regret to not have bought an Android tablet. Both boys are complaining that are not happy...
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo N.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad peice of kit for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Fire so I could read my iPhone-account Kindle books on a bigger screen. It has a decent screen that can be shaded/brightened easily, a superb battery life and I can live with Amazon's relentless selling of Kindle titles. It is lightweight and easy to hold (I've bought a 3rd party case). I have found the borwser (SILK) gets me around OK.
customer_reviews.author: FictionLover

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a broken Hudl that I had used for a number of years. So disappointed this tablet is so very slow. Even opening a book is painful while and writing this I find keyboard not very responsive. I knew it wouldn't be the same but after 2/3 weeks still unhappy.. 😞😞
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: Truly shocking response times
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a tablet out of the dark ages - the lag is so noticeable its hardly useable.... So bad I only use it as an alarm clock (when Alexa wakes up that is after 10+ seconds) Only drop in video calls do not work despite what customer services said..as a result Show mode is a waste of space especially as when you go to the Alexa app the device is always shown as being offline. So don't buy if you think you're getting a Show type device...
customer_reviews.author: J T.

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The product is of a robust construction but with the charging dock it's quite heavy. The responce from the device screen is slow and the operating responce is generally unacceptable. The Alexa app is not very responsive and the volume is very low. The device seems a poor Echo Dot with a screen. The sound quality is terrible. My device is not able to find any apps despite having tried everything. A waste of money but for the occasional read as it functions as a good reader. If I hadn't thrown away the box I would have sent it back. What a pity it doesn't function with Android.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: All New Kindle fire HD8 delivers!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this Kindle after the sad demise of my 3rd one after 5years, so far so good! I use my device socially and for educational and spiritual development daily. I am happy with the new look and functions, thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet
customer_reviews.text: My first ever tablet, had an issue with sky Q as not on the amazon app store, used apkmonk to get it and now it works ok, can be slow to open apps but once running no issues
customer_reviews.author: Funtime

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my Lenovo Tab 3--This is slllooowwww,also no grand theft auto,even though on my original Fire,,,all bought,,now nowhere?😒operating system,browser,,,stinks...I now only use for podcasts....
customer_reviews.author: RickMurray666

customer_reviews.title: Good buy but could be quicker.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade from my previous Kindle Fire HD8 which I bought in Nov 2015. Overall I’m pleased with my new purchase and this eighth generation. But it should be significantly quicker with a faster processor and it is only marginally quicker and some old apps I previously had on my old model no longer seem to be available with the latest update after I restored my back up to the new kindle. But for about £99 and the ease of use when buying everything digital from Amazon and being able to watch Prime Video or Netflix alongside reading books, who can grumble?!
customer_reviews.author: redwolfsix

customer_reviews.title: Too buggy
customer_reviews.text: I've had so much trouble with mine. Not being able to log in to twitter, sometimes the screen refusing to sleep and the device going hot and running down the battery as a result. A couple of times it has just refused to work and I've had to let the battery rundown to restart it. Really disappointed because my previous one didnt give me this much trouble and I only replaced it because it was stolen. I only read books on it so it is giving me way more trouble than it should
customer_reviews.author: Feyi Fawehinmi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This item may be great value if you don't mind being tied to Amazon but otherwise forget it. You can't even access the Google play store direct from this tablet and mine would not retain the wireless access code for my BT5 hub. Took it back to shop and exchanged it for a Samsung Tab, more expensive but a whole lot better.
customer_reviews.author: iddychas

customer_reviews.title: overpriced junk
customer_reviews.text: The Tablet itself is not a patch on my Hudl2 which I bought over 4 years ago. The docking station is almost useless and apallingly bad value for money. I would recommend no one wastes their money on buying one ! most other tablets are far better value for money. This is my review and as such is my opinion based on subsequent research ,prompted by disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: freethinker

customer_reviews.title: I just love my Fire 8"HD 16GB.
customer_reviews.text: Cant imagine life without it. It is so easy to use and so comprehensive in it's coverage. I use mine for games, books and browsing the internet mostly. The knowledge that it will do all I need it to do really builds confidence in the product. The tone and sound quality is exceptional. I love it and its so versatile I don't need piles of books and mags pile up by my chair. My Fire cover it all. Incidentally I am 76 years old and I feel very much a "Silver Surfer" since I have had this.
customer_reviews.author: Normaliz

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought this tablet was I wanted to watch my online courses but as Flash doesn't work on this tablet, I can't use it. I tried few ways flash can be installed but none of them have worked so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pandey Ji

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: An Excellent value for money tablet does most of the things you would expect from a tablet in this price show mode needs more work Alexa struggles to hear you even in a quiet environment the show mode dock is very good Keep the tablet charged and ready to use. Alexa on the tablet does not have the same functions as the echo show or echo spot you cannot control your Bluetooth speaker set up or your home lights on the screen no slider or on/ off button on the screen itself hopefully Amazon will bring this in a future update. The sound is not good could be a little louder sound quality is not very good
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: The main issue with this tablet (I have bought 2 for my children) is that is constantly freezing and becoming unresponsive. It has to be restarted constantly. Then, you can't give kids access to Alexa or Prime Movies. I'm not even talking about not possible to install Play Store. As it passed a bit over 1month, I can't return them for a refund. I would definitely not recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: 7rc

customer_reviews.title: Fired up about my  Fire tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good size screen, good for reading, videos etc.., Good selection of apps. The blue shade is good thing for those using Kindle books. Silk is a very good browse just as good as Google. When watching youtube unable to do anything else. Would be good to have a split screen function to view as well as write. I like the hands-free Alexa function. Overall a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Hennessey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 2 months, only purchased because of Prime day.. At £45 it was too much. Hands down the most awful piece of technology I've ever owned, and I once owned an Atari Jaguar. The good: Absolutely nothing. The bad: Quiet speakers, poor low res display (in what world is this HD?) The Ugly: Bloatware, full of prime video and book ads, even when you lock the screen, there are ads. Which makes the tablet so slow, it's un-use able. The only way to avoid the Bloatware is to reinstall Android on it and Google play services but by the time you have done that, you may as well buy another tablet which is half decent. Avoid like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Robert James

customer_reviews.title: Can't install many games or Family Link.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have Google Play, so my daughter can't download the games friends are all playing. She has paid for some games on her Google account, but now Amazon wants to be paid for the same games. Doesn't support Family Link, so can't manage time spent, etc like we can with other kids phones and tablets. Basically, one unhappy daughter, thinks she got a crummy gift. Thanks for that Amazon. There's a reason Amazon tablets are cheap: they are crippled by Amazon to force you to use their system. I wish I'd spent a bit more and got a 'normal' Android tablet that can do everything.
customer_reviews.author: Susannah

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Poor comparison to other tablets. I expected quality product and didn’t get one!.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all! It beggars belief that you cannot cast to tv from this tablet and Amazon don’t support reputable apps to allow it to happen. Update; I had a phone call from Amazon customer support who were very apologetic about the shortfalls of this item. However. 4 days later and it gets worse! Apparently, Shopping apps for supermarkets aren’t supported. The app for Tesco to do my shop isn’t supported. If this is some ploy by Amazon to ‘guide’ owners into using their services- whoever thought that was a good idea should be sacked! Another 2 days of trying and this is going to be returned as ‘not as described’
customer_reviews.author: safetyguy

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD 8"  with hands free Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Yes I like my new Amazon Fire 8" HD. To be honest I don't see a great deal of difference from my previous Fire . Occasionally I've not been able to get the Home page back when I've not used it for a couple of hours and have had to plug it into the mains to get it back which is a bit annoying but on the whole I'm very pleased with it. I have no need for Alexa but I'm sure many people will be thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: June Barker (East Sussex)

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's app store is very poor, and it's all this tablet can work with.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this tablet mainly in order to read--not only Kindle books. But there are very few apps that work on it. E.g., the Economist and other papers don't work. It is true that got good reviews and it's very cheap, but if you wish to use it for reading--don't try.
customer_reviews.author: M. Keren

customer_reviews.title: caught on fire only used 6 times do not buy
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY st time I used it my amazon account got hacked screen whent white around had a worning from Microsoft saying device made my account unsecure factory reset device decided to try again then it happened smoke burning smell and flames yes flames everywhere DO NOT BUY AS I THREW IT IN KITCHEN SINK TO PUT FIRE OUT WHEN I GOT IT OUT IT STARTED TO BURN AGAIN ive taken devive to trading standards this was a Christmas present off my wife so no paperwork to return it good commitment to quality and safty
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!  Amazon fills it with pop up adds that stop you from using it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I have ever purchased. Do not buy this tablet, it is not the same as normal tablets, there are popup ads all over the place, videos , offensive content and it is impossible to remove without paying amazon. While using the tablet adverts covering the entire screen cause the device to freeze repeatedly, and again you CANNOT DISABLE THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Really slow device, very bad overall
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is painfully slow to the extent that it is almost unusable. It really feels like something from 5 years ago. I would not recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Stay away !!
customer_reviews.text: I actually thought this would be a gooden but it’s proved me wrong !!! I’ve only used it twice since having it and it’s so bloody slow and trying to open apps is a mission!! If I knew this was gonna happen I would of got an iPad and spent a bit more !!! Don’t waste your money !!!
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased I bought this
customer_reviews.text: My previous Kindle Fire was the second generation and was getting a bit laggy. This one is much faster and has the added benefit of a micro sd port to increase personal storage. I don't use it to its full capabilities and have no use for Alexa. However, I like to listen to music and having a micro sd card has huge benefits for this. The sound is a bit tinny but connecting an Anker bluetooth portable speaker the sound is then great. It's a marvelous device for the price compared to other tablets. The ads irritated me more than I initially thought they would so I paid the £10 to have them removed.
customer_reviews.author: Panny

customer_reviews.title: RE: My Estimation Of Amazon Has Plummeted!
customer_reviews.text: Hi folks, In two years I am now on my fifth Fire HD8. The first four have all died. It seems that these devices only have a six month lifespan!I Not only that, the service at the South African Amazon repair centre is dreadful. Promises never kept, call back appointments not honoured, and agents failing to denote conversations and agreements on their system. I have literally wasted endless hours dealing with inadequate staff. Needless to say Amazon have now list themselves a once very loyal customer! My strong advice is to buy a different model by a different manufacturer from a different retailer. Best, Paul David Seaman (UK)
customer_reviews.author: monsterjazzlicks

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant... Cracking bit of kit. (Only £44.99)
customer_reviews.text: I was going to write a full scale review, on this Fire HD8 but as many people can see, especially if you own one. There is no need to say anything because these little Tabs are quite simply Awesome. Been contemplating buying one for ages but so glad I decided to! They are a brilliant piece of kit. No need to worry about memory/storage, just equip yourself with a SD card, mine (256Gbt) and all your worries disappear. Cracking Tab, so buy one, you will not be disappointed 😀 👍 🔌💻 Joner (Electronics Engineer / HiFi nutter) 27/11/19
customer_reviews.author: Joner

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I already have the Paper White Kindle but really wanted a colour screen for my cookery books as it's sooo much nicer and easier to follow. I don't use the Fire as a Tablet as I already have a Samsung Tablet so I use it mainly for Alexa which I love and for reading books. I sometimes download mail also. It is slower than the Samsung Tablet but that's not really a problem for me. I love my Fire and now would not be without it....oh yes, I bought the stand which is brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Fire Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Yet another one thrown away! after all this time I expected Amazon to have fixed the wafer thin screen, you only have to fart and it would break! this is my last one until they get the screen toughened up, I even had a shockproof cover on it fell of the bed and it smashed to bits, I do not recommend and also to add to this when it was working the screen is not bright enough and they on screen keyboard is for twigs than fingers this and the fact I cannot download an official YouTube app is ruining it all, get it sorted Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Daz

customer_reviews.title: For 50 Quid? Can't be Beaten
customer_reviews.text: You've got to admit, for less than 50 quid.. This is pretty peerless. I've been reading on it now since I got it and it's a lovely, easy to use tablet. Plays media beautifully and links to your account alarmingly fast. I bought one to read from as have been using the Kindle app on my tablet and wanted something a little smaller and easier to use. Very lightweight and seems to work quickly without much lag or issue. I would recommend closing apps after you've finished with them though. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MDWS18

customer_reviews.title: Designed to: 1. Restrict you, and 2. Sell more Amazon stuff. Nothing else included.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a computer in the normal sense of the word. It's an Amazon-directed drone with a mission to sell. It will take you hours or days to make it function 50% like a regular tablet, finding workarounds and hacks to use apps that don't directly benefit Amazon. Don't waste your time. A regular Android tablet from anywhere else would be a better purchase, even at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Tuke

customer_reviews.title: Beware of secret strings attached and charges £€¥$
customer_reviews.text: I really hate this thing. It's good for what I got it for. To entertain the child whilst in the car. When on charge the kindle peeps constantly with adverts. When I discovered how to unsubscribe from this, I was charged by Amazon £10.00 without a single warning. I was livid as it's clearly foul play by Amazon. Still waiting for my refund. The app are not as good say on an android device. My advice is if you can afford to go a little bit more go for a device with less strings attached.
customer_reviews.author: Ikky

customer_reviews.title: Updated Fire HD 8 tablet
customer_reviews.text: My old Fire tablet was still in frequent use and the only problem I had was the battery draining fairly swiftly and increasing slowness. Update to the Fire HD 8 tablet and I find great speed, great display, Alexa built in and a much more streamlined experience. The charging is easy and the fact that you can see on the screen what you have streamed. Downloading is much quicker. I do like the Fire tablets for ease of use, reliability, clear display and ease of putting in a handbag or briefcase; light in weight but solidly built. What is there to dislike?
customer_reviews.author: Annel

customer_reviews.title: Its a tablet!
customer_reviews.text: My only experience before this with tablets was the very cheap Far East ones of 10 ish years ago... bad screens and worse responces.... But this is a thing of beauty, works quickly - allowing for a few teathing issues and a forced re-start here and there to get the first update to work! I purchased this to give Alexa an upgrade! and she seems a lot happier with her new output, speakers fine, screen excellent and the adverts arnt as bad as some others have said.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Plus points: Good quality and stylish item with very good specification for the money. Easy to get started and intuitive to use. Attractive formatting and comprehensive range of apps easily available. Streaming and downloading have worked perfectly. Negatives: Screen is so glossy that reflections make it hard to use as an E-reader in bright light. Screen resolution is rather dark for viewing programmes, even when brightness has been turned up. I hadn't anticipated being bombarded with so much advertising for "special offers" - mostly cheap starter options for subscription services with higher fees if not cancelled within 3 months etc. Overall, my reaction is positive - great value for money, but not perfect by some way.
customer_reviews.author: Reg Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This is BRILLIANT!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this. I bought it initially to replace a buggered kindle - even though all of the online reviews and Youtube commentators said it if you want it for reading e-books, you are better with a kindle. (I got it because it was cheaper . . . yes . . . I'm tight!). Anyway - it is excellent for e-books, and I also have Audible on it, and can get TV and Radio, as well as play my dowloaded music and access my e-mails. There may be more things it can do, but I am more than happy with these. Superb product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Lazy Kipper

customer_reviews.title: Basically an Amazon Advertisement machine in your lap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to use. Otherwise she'd be on my laptop and we don't want that do we? The function of this tablet seems to basically be to beam advertisement for all sorts of tat that this fine site hawk to unsuspecting people. I've tried to use it for basic internet browsing and it's less than useful. It can't find the (strong) home Wifi signal half of the time and the rest it of the time it's playing ads for coma inducing games. Avoid this by buying something not affiliated with the world's richest man.
customer_reviews.author: gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my ancient iPad. Although I can't get all the apps that I could from Apple, I just save the web pages on my browser. Internet is fast, the fire uses Silk . Camera is not the best but I didn't buy it to take photos. Battery life is very good, lasting 2 days with normal use. The home page is nice and easy to navigate books and magazines. I don't use Alexa so I can't comment on that, but for the price it is well worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: L. D'Costa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The hardware its self is not the problem its amazons limited OS. Cant install apps from google play store, doesnt even have google play store, you have to mess about altering the whole. once u install an APK there is no way to install it to the kid account, Infuriating to use. probably the worst tablet ive ever used There is no file browser... Just everything you want to do there is some block or issue or simply wont allow it to be done. I can NOT reccomend it, it is simply infuriatng and frustrating to try to do anything on other than what amazon wants you to go on (eg only amazon things!). 100% terrible product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and very well equipped
customer_reviews.text: Primarily to assist my reading. Having deteriorating eyesight, the ability to invert book text - white text on black background - makes a major difference to reading in real comfort. The fact that it is also a well equipped tablet is a bonus I hadn't expected.
customer_reviews.author: John Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bit of Kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bit of kit. For the amount of money that this costs it is truly a steal! PROS - Quad core processor. - Very decent battery life. - Decent variety of apps for Fire OS (though no YouTube) - Excellent support should you need it. - Speakers are decent. - Quite lightweight. CONS - Screen resolution and brightness could be better. - Camera quality is poor. - OS feels a bit convoluted. Overall a brilliant little device which is ideal to take on holiday or a long journey to watch saved NetFlix or Amazon Video on. However, this is definitely not an iPad replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Operation of the device needs to be improved , overall happy with it for reading.
customer_reviews.text: Bit disappointed , in some ways very handy but sometimes almost uncontrollable, at times it appears to have a mind of it's own. It is certainly nothing to do with with a lack of experience of technology I have other devices that are a lot more reliable but admittedly much more expensive. In fact in the middle of typing this, the screen went off then back to home screen. As a reading device it is very handy and great for books and publications but it's operation is very frustrating at times ,occasionally very awkward to unlock !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check if you can download apps from playstore before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: DISAPPOINTED! It feels and looks good but I can't download my favourite apps from Playstore. This keyboard is so limited after using Swiftkey. Amazon locks you into their options so many other choices are not available. also can't cast to my smart tv without a Fire stick (is there a subscription for this, haven't investigated yet) I'm returning this and continue on my Android phone instead.
customer_reviews.author: MargieP

customer_reviews.title: Durable good quality, value for money, perfect for kids.
customer_reviews.text: For the price these can be got for, they are fantastic for the kids, great battery life usually 7-8 hours of constant use, a good clear screen and extremely durable, for what you can get in an android tablet at the same price point it's a no brainer. Although I would love to see android on this device due to more app availability, my boys have gotten by just fine with what's available in the app store. Does not come with a plug and I would recommend getting a fast charging one.
customer_reviews.author: Bex and Perry

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP and Nearly USELESS!
customer_reviews.text: I got the Fire HD 8 Tablet with Alexa, 8" HD (16GB) on £49.99 deal from Amazon (used it for 2 month, and even I returned it) 1. TOO SLOW. 2. USES SOME WEIRD AMAZON OPERATING SYSTEM (which is rubbish). 3. HORRIBLE AMAZON APPS. 4. LITTLE FREEDOM TO ACCESS & OPEN SD CARD (your own books/files) and to get them too work. 5. COMES FULL OF ANNOYING AMAZON "POP-UP ADS" Only Good as a cheap, small movie player. Otherwise USELESS
customer_reviews.author: Music Man

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This review must be read with the purchase price in mind. I find it responsive with very good screen and acceptable sound. Initially I purchased and installed a 128gb memory card which caused difficulty whenever the tablet was switched on. The card had an implied association with the tablet on the Amazon web pages. I contacted Amazon about the problem and after a very long webchat I was advised that the card was incompatible, I should have fitted a class 10 card. I have since purchased a class 10 card from Amazon and my original problem has gone away. Now I am entirely happy with the tablet which I believe is a great performer and is excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpygranddad

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is 6 for Christmas but he hates it and so do I. The screen response is terrible you have to swipe at least 3 times before it opens. It is full of Amazon bloatware that you don't need. It feels cheap and it was cheap at £44 Black Friday deal. I still sent it back. Will stick with my 4 year old iPad. Also I bought the fire dock which is also rubbish as it doesn’t stay in show mode so what’s the point in that. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Great new additions
customer_reviews.text: Great additions such as Alexa. Good screen size. Does everything I want it to do such as e.mails, books, weather, camera and loads more. Good value. Wish there was a setting up booklet with the product for those of us not so IT savvy! A friend also bought one and because she doesn't have a PC or similar it was difficult for her to get to grips with the product without having to pay for a tutorial.
customer_reviews.author: Floss Morgan

customer_reviews.title: con
customer_reviews.text: Although the kindle is a fantastic little tablet for it's price, Amazon con you with a "get it £10 cheaper" with special offers. what they don't tell you is that the special offer is, you get it £10 cheaper because they force adverts on you! i bought this for my son's christmas present, he is five years old and doesn't need to be harassed by constant adverts on his tablet, so i've had to pay the extra £10 to have the adverts removed. not happy about this tbh, yes its only £10 but they should make it very clear why it's £10 cheaper in the first place, and not make out that you're getting some kind of special offer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap tablet but with restricted functionality, parental controls poorly thought out.
customer_reviews.text: Both adults in the house own Kindle Fire tablets so when it came to time for our daughter (9) to upgrade we thought we'd get her one as well as she had been watching on mine for ages. What a mistake. The parental controls on the tablet are next to useless. For a 3-6 year old the child profile might work but after that unless you're happy to have your child see the notifications for every present you buy you're well out of luck and in for a world of frustration. We're sending it back and getting her an iPad after confirming with tech support that the only way round it would be to buy her her own prime subscription...
customer_reviews.author: A. Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working four month in....
customer_reviews.text: However, this was remedied via the online chat for the Kindle support. I feel like an expert myself, should have kept the transcript to remember how to do it next time! Other than that, great price because I bought it when it was on offer and could opt for the monthly payments. Nice size, graphics look good, I think this is my fourth or fifth Kindle and 3rd Fire, I really like them and their practicality rather than lumbering around a laptop, not forgetting reading books and listening to audio books, I think I'll always have one. Lightweight and easy enough to use for the not so IT savvy person like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Fabulous37

customer_reviews.title: What's going on, Amazon?
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Kindle. The Kindle Fire is a great concept and offers a true alternative to The ipad. I replaced my last one because I thought it had a virus but it appears this machine is exactly the same and looking at reviews Amazon has known this for a while. It is incredibly slow. Very very very slow and yes Amazon I have rebooted etc but it appears that Amazon are either using naff processors or their QC on their processors are not very good. I've used pen and paper faster than the Fire HD. So disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: GW Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't technology be getting better?
customer_reviews.text: Had a 7HDX before. Thought it was ridiculous a screen the size of a postcard had such high definition. I didn't realise how wrong I was until I saw this. The speed of the processor is slower which also doesn't help the graphics and is noticeable in other ways too. I put the cheapness of the tablet down to Moore's law and Amazon expecting to get sales from a captive market. It wasn't. A distinct step back from a high water mark. It doesn't make the tablet unusable but things better improve. I won't be so lazy next time. Took rating down to one star when I discovered it will not load music rescued from 7HDX.
customer_reviews.author: George Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful (for a reason). Nasty Apps and UI.
customer_reviews.text: I have Amazon Prime, and work away a lot, so Fire HD 8 seemed the perfect solution to having entertainment away from the home. Plus points:- -Awesome sound, amazing stereo effects. -Great Amazon Prime library to choose from. -Good battery life. -Reasonably inexpensive Bad points:- -Screen contrast. It is so bad that you can barely see any detail during daylight hours. -Amazon Prime app is infuriatingly buggy. I have yet to open the app, download anything more than 1 series, and NOT have the app crash. (App works seamlessly on iPad) -Actually, the entire UI is buggy, and most apps will, sooner rather than later, crash. -Amazon App Store hasn’t got half of the most popular apps.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good viewing.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third tablet I've purchased from Amazon since 'lockdown'. I think this speaks for itself as to how much I am enjoying them. My night time Paperwhite is particularly essential since it allows me to read during the night, when I can't sleep. The reason I purchased the Samsung Galaxy Tab A, and the fire HD8, is that public libraries are still closed, and I need my vital reading material i.e. 4 books a week!! I have three books 'on the go' upstairs, including my Paperwhite, and two books downstairs. I'm also spending far too much money on kindle book offers to swell my library, but I love it . Perhaps I nee some 'therapy'!!!
customer_reviews.author: GRAHAM MANN

customer_reviews.title: So far
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace older version which had seen better days, at offer price it would appear to be good value. Hopefully this one has a better life in the battery, I tend to abuse them a little but it saves using my mobile at times and they cost a damn sight more so it makes sense to me. Took minutes to remove old one from "my devices" and register new one. All my books and saved content switched over seamlessly. I wasn't sure about apps so i downloaded them again, no hassle though. So far all looks good. Old one will be sold this week so wallet wont be hurt much at all.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Get the HD 10 Instead
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to like this tablet, the colour yellow looks fantastic. but thats where it ends. performance is lacking in even the most basics tasks. installing apps takes an age, side-loading anything takes forever. slow sluggish and not fit for purpose. im sure when it first came out it was great. But a years worth of updates have basically made it a door stop. I havent even bothered with the camera but who would at this price point.. Im sure its fine for drop in via alexa and stuff didnt try. so its going back..
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I've had kindled for many years and loved my last one a 7" kindle fire hd. Unfortunatelthe charging port broke or something and it no longer world .this time I bought the 8" but I wish I'd stayed with a smaller one for size it was easier to hold for reading. I'm not technically minded and have struggled to learn how things work with this one as there are no instructions really. The back camera is a great addition but the pictures not great The start-up noise is tinie and the words on the start up are plain white I'm due my old one changed to red so much nicer.all in all I preferred my old one
customer_reviews.author: hazel

customer_reviews.title: Worked for less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for amazon prime which it worked excellently as well as to read my kindle books again o had no issue. However my fire tablet no longer works. After a period where I hadn't used it in a while approx a month I found the battery had died so charged it but even after hours it wouldn't turn on and kept indicating a dead battery and while charging refused to turn on. It is now useless after less than a year
customer_reviews.author: SiÃ¢n Frater

customer_reviews.title: Secure enough??
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of it and the weight. I took it on holiday and didn't find it too cumbersome. However, I don't feel that it is as secure as my previous tablet and loathe to do my banking on it so still use my old tablet for that. I don't find it so easy to delete my old history as on my old tablet. I go into history to delete things I don't want left on there but when I next do a search the old history still seems to pop up. Also I usually order photos through FreePrint app but I can't seem to download it onto my Fire tablet
customer_reviews.author: marion langan

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy if you want full control of your tablet pc locked to amazon
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy if you want control of your own tablet Locked into Amazon cant sign into my google account without giving amazon full access to my emails. FULL of adverts pop ups , not what you think your going to get , waiting to get it rooted to remove all the amazon stuff. Very infuriating using with popups and limited usage. Ok if you buy everything off amazon read all their books and watch all their films . If you want full control over your tablet then dont buy it get an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Retrosheep

customer_reviews.title: No good if you want YouTube Kids
customer_reviews.text: Extremely frustrating that basic things like YouTube Kids simply aren't available. Probably the one thing my 3 year old son uses the most and despite having bought him this tablet to save him using my phone all the time, he usually ends up just having to use my phone anyway, which avoids the point. Probably just as well it has a damage warranty, I would expect quite a few people would get irate with that alone. Despite being based on Android, There are other basic android features missing even in the adult profile such as screen pinning. Quality seems OK for the money but might be better off spending money on a proper Android tablet or a cheap used iPad.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Great size and fantastic quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this and use it daily. It its perfect as a ereader however if you was getting it as a tablet google play isn't compatible with it. As an ereader though its fantastic i have never had a sune glare and i take it with me everywhere. I love that i have options to turn of blue light when i want to. In the books you can change front and size really easy. I love the option to highlight passage or use the dictionary on different words. I sometimes use play back if i want to hear how to prounce words. Its the perfect size for poping in my handbag.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet - Kids Option very difficult to setup
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality and the screen, but took me ages to set up a childs profile and then assign the apps. I have found a number of times the apps failing too which means I have to remove from their profile, and re-add. I also have two of these and for some reason couldn't get the web-browser to work at first on one despite being setup exactly the same, but eventually did but I'm not sure how. Have also found that they often lock-up and have to be restarted. The Kids profiles are good but I think probably better for younger children as it is very restrictive (which is good)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Usually great
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this item. It is the eighth Kindle I have had and the first to give problems so early on. While filling in a survey the screen jumped back and forward between windows, and not even apps I had open. It kept switching to Camera and not allowing me to close it. I have never been known for my patience and this tested me to the nth degree. I will be sending it back and asking for a new one. Please don't let this review put you off getting a Kindle Fire. They are fantastic and the reason I have had so many is that I keep filling them up!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Koot

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with BT Hub
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my Mum and mother in law. great little product but I am afraid it would not connect to internet. Even though connected to wifi it would not go on to internet. It seems as it has problem with BT hubs. I tried to get help on line but with no joy. At the end gave up and returned the product
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased with with the sole intention of using it as a research tool as I returned to college. I use it for three things, downloading and reading PDF whitepapers, watching videos and participating in online lectures and finally, email of course. I find the battery life to be excellent, I don't even bother turning the device off, the battery conservation is that good. Granted, the amount of pre-installed apps which cannot be removed is a bit of a pain as I will never use them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Glenn Dollard

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality Lets this down!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Kindle Fire along with my paper Wight which I use for just reading. Following my previous Fire a 16 GB addition , thank goodness I kept it for the amplified sound quality ! For the Fire 8 as an entertainment device and tablet its amazing , for Sky Go, BBC I player etc. , but this is my second model, sent fist back as sound quality is so poor !! However I have resolved this issue by using blue tooth headphones and therefore making it acceptable ! Besides the sound quality an affordably good tablet for all your needs and its worth getting the 32GB which has an SD card slot to expand the storage vastly.
customer_reviews.author: R.O. P

customer_reviews.title: Can't Believe They Managed To Improve It!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is the 2nd kindle I have had, my son had another make of tablet but preferred my kindle so I kind of lost that one but my lovely Dad went out and bought me a brand new kindle fire 8 hd. I was happy with my older one but couldn't believe how they had managed to improve it. The battery lasts a lot longer and the volume buttons on the side are a god send. Excellent product, well it must be good if my techno son prefers my old kindle to his much newer tablet and I'm chuffed to bits with my new tablet. Thanks for the excellent bit of kit amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lorraine M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of tablets to date and the Fire HD 8 (8th gen) represents great value for money, considering the fact that I purchased it on the Black Friday sales too. Whilst it is a little underwhelming for 3D stuff it really shines on all other fronts and does everything you ask of it seamlessly once updated and setup. Great tablet for about the 6th of the cost of the other major brands out there. You get what you pay for sure, but in this case you get a well rounded tablet experience for not a lot of money. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mobile Amusements

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace another Fire Kindle which the battery just gave up charging after 3 years. I am very disappointed in this one's performance, I have contacted Amazon couple of times , reset it to factory settings , and still it under performs, the transition from page to page is jolted, stopping, sticking, having to reboot in order to clear the blockage. I did the research before I bought it but feel it is not up to standard. The other one was fast, smooth, no problems except battery died.I would like it changed for another up to date model, but that is another story for review later.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Russell

customer_reviews.title: awful start-up sound
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is perfectly adequate for my needs which are, Kindle, browsing internet, few small games. The camera isn't a lot to write home about. What I really hate about it is the sound it makes when you switch on and there doesn't seem any way to mute it - very annoying. I've tried asking a question and have had a lots of suggestions none of which work. In fact in settings for this tablet turning off the notification volume is not an option which is strange I can only presume it has not been programmed properly in the first place. Makes me wonder what else does not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Case

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this for children
customer_reviews.text: I bought a previous version of this a couple of years ago and wanted a second one for my children... very pleased - they find it easy to use, the screen quality is good, works for Mathletics and Youtube. I like the memory card slot so I can put their films/shows on there, and it's cheap enough that I won't get too upset if it doesn't last for years and years... so far so good. Performance is good - I do recommend adding Google Play Store as the Amazon App Store can be a bit limited - various articles are around detailing what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Simons

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my tablet. If I'd known why the difference in price then I would have spent the extra £5 for no ads, but they don't bother me much. The battery life is quite good but sure it could be better, it lasts about 8 hours if being used constantly. I'd definitely recommend this tablet, I loved taking it on holiday. Very good for the plane.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Coles

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Kindle
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3 rd kindle 2nd kindle fire. I have always used kindle for emails internet play g games. Only problem I have is i break the screen's. This mustard one was bought as a gift from my lovely daughter and son in law. The only problem I had with this one is for some reason when I set it up it accepted it was my 3rd kindle but would not transfer all my apps games and programmes some of which I have paid for. No one can explain why this happened or can give me advise. Other than that I have always been impressed with the kindle
customer_reviews.author: donch

customer_reviews.title: Missing Feature in Fire HD 8
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Fire HD 8 tablet and, for the most part, it behaves as expected. It has a nice size and screen and it is easy hold and navigate. However, I was very disappointed to discover the lack of a multi-column view in the Kindle app. On the Kindle app for iPad and normal Android the two column view is available when you use the tablet in landscape mode. Unfortunately, this feature appears to be missing on Amazon's own device. This is especially disappointing considering I also purchased the Origami case, which makes it easy to view the tablet in landscape mode.
customer_reviews.author: boslon

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD 8
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the Fire HD 8. It is easy to use although I haven't yet used all the facilities. This did warrant 5 stars but I have given 4 as I am not happy that, although ordering from Amazon is quick and easy, I do not have to sign in with a password. Security is uppermost and although I know I can lock the screen, it would be so easy for anyone to order anything from Amazon in my name. It is important that this tablet isn't left unattended! I really would like to log in with my password/email when ordering from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs G.

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: This is the 10th ( I think ), Fire device I have had. After dropping my 7" one for the umpteenth time, the screen cracked again. Was just about to order a new 7" fire only to be sent a email from amazon with a price decrease of the 8" fire coming in at £5 less than the 7" . As I used my 7" for reading all the time, and checking that the new one would fit inside my coat pocket it was a no brainer which one to get. Still use my 10" every night to watch Sky or Netflix when a different programme is being watched by my significant other.
customer_reviews.author: prp3108

customer_reviews.title: Not for me!
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to this tablet and the show dock... but...Extremely slow to respond. Full of adware???? Didn't realise there was a one off payment of £10 to remove the really annoying pop up ads??? I have owned several tablets, I guess you pay for what you get. This is by far the slowest for browser and tasks. The show dock, Alexa was also very slow to respond. A little bit like the old internet days when you wait several seconds for a page to load (& i have sky fibre optic). Returned for refund
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: Slow and unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: This is my second second Fire HD. I had an HD 10" but returned it because it's appallingly slow and unresponsive. My Fire HDX 7" which was a fantastic tablet finally gave up after 5 years of solid use, so I replaced it with the new gen Fire 8". I should have learned from my first experience as this is no better. I know they are less than £100 and for storing and playing music, films etc, they are great. It's just rubbish at being a tablet for browsing and the like as it's so slow and unresponsive. Come on Amazon, bring back something equivalent to the HDX! I'd personally be happy to pay the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: simon.l-a

customer_reviews.title: Brutally Slow
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small tablet for a little surfing, checking email and perhspa some reading. Unfortunately, this tablet is brutally slow in it's functionality. I seem to spend more time waiting for it to catch up than anything else. Waiting for webpages to load is a nightmare even when there's little running in the background and it has this really annoying habit of not letting you delete a space after typing a word without deleting the whole word. I suppose it's £79 for a reason, I'd return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: John Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD 8 Tablet with Alexa, 8" HD Display
customer_reviews.text: What can I say - get one of these instead of the Amazon Show with the charging station and you're all set. I've had Amazon Echo's for a number of years now and they are fantastic, this takes it to another level, you won't be disappointed. Having the screen makes a whole world of difference to your Echo experience, portable, informative and just like the Echo you know and love. Connect to an external speaker if you want for a greater sound experience but even without, you'll still love it. Do not hesitate to get one of these instead of the Echo Show at a fraction of the price!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on holiday rather than risk my rather more expensive apple product. Wasn't disappointed !! Once you get used to the interface it's quite easy to use. Downloaded videos from amazon prime and watched on the plane, same for music. Struggled to get free wi-fi at the airport, found the service but just wouldn't take me to the login screen :-( iPhone connected straight away. Battery life could be better, noticed this compared to iPad, but for the money can't complain at all. Worth the extra to get the no special offers version so no unwanted disruptions. Overall I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Phill Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Its alright
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the sale to replace my kindle which was being annoyingly slow, thinking I could also use it as a tablet and download other apps...basically like a bigger version of my phone. Well, the app store is like something from the 80s (...slight exaggeration). I get not allowing a competitor's app/s but I shouldn't have trouble downloading a transport app. All in all I'd say invest in a proper tablet as you can download Amazon and kindle apps. Will keep this as its cheap for what it is but would like a bit more freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable at the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement for my now aged but much loved Kobo Arc, The Fire HD 8 is unbeatable for the money, especially at the much reduced Black Friday price. Although very Amazon and well worth paying extra to be more ad free, it's simple to load the Google Play store (plenty of how to do it hints on the web) if you want some of the apps not available from Amazon. OK, it's not an ipad but if you want to surf the web, do some social media, play games,watch film and TV, send emails, Skype etc etc, etc why would you need to spend more?
customer_reviews.author: F P CORRIGAN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my Mothers ebook reader as she found she needed larger print to read. With the kindle app on it she can have the text as large as she wants and can easily adjust it. She has also tried out pod casts and watching prime video. She finds it easy to use which is a big plus. The screen is bright and the resolution gives a very clear picture whether you're reading text or watching a movie. The speakers are fine considering the size but she usually uses headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine once you've sideloaded Google Play
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that Amazon repeatedly mails me to review an item that I bought at Argos. Yes, it's an Amazon-badged tablet that I have linked to my Amazon account, but all the same, it feels intrusive. The tablet itself seems fine, and is very good value indeed when on special offer at under £45. These Amazon offers are always mirrored by high street retailers. First thing to do is sideload Google Play to improve the variety of apps. Second thing to do is to go to ebay to find a tailored case for £6.
customer_reviews.author: Yersinia pestis

customer_reviews.title: Good but SD card issue
customer_reviews.text: Good sized tablet with clear screen. Haven't used the Alexa mode much as have other devices for that. Deducted a point as every time I go to the Games/Apps section the previously downloads are shown as "app unavailable.SD card not found" and have to be downloaded again - very frustrating. Have tried removing the memory card and re-inserting but still the same. My old 7inch tablet used to do the same but if left for a few minutes the games/apps would be ready to go without having to download again.
customer_reviews.author: lindyloo

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over the Fire 7
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has had 3 'fire 7', we were almost using them as disposable, as inevitably the micro-usb port would break. This HD 8 has lasted a year of abuse(and I mean abuse) with no issues what so ever. It has an expansion slot for sd card, which has allowed us to load movies on it for traveling in the car with no wifi. The increased screen size(and reduced bevel) from the 7 is also a good improvement to give a more modern look to the tablet. I don't see us buying her a new tablet in the near future as this has all the functionality she will ever need. Definitely worth the increased price over the 7.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed overall. Was looking at an iPad mini but when I reviewed what I actually wanted from a tablet I thought I’d try the Fire 8 HD. Am very glad I did too. Literally £55 delivered, and I’m paying for that over 5 months! I’ve added my own micro SD which cost about a fiver and am pleasantly surprised by the speed, display, battery life. The special offers are a bit annoying so it could be worth you paying the extra to have these turned off. For the money you can’t go wrong, particularly if you’re like me who uses a number of amazon prime services, plus the usual facebook, Twitter apps etc.
customer_reviews.author: Simon J George

product_meta.title: Fire HD 8 Tablet, 16 GB, Black—with Special Offers (Previous Generation - 8th)
feature_bullets: Vibrant 8" HD display and up to 10 hours of battery life.
1.3 GHz quad-core processor, 1.5 GB of RAM and Dolby Atmos audio.
16 or 32 GB of internal storage and a microSD slot for up to 512 GB of expandable storage.
2 MP front-facing camera and 2 MP rear-facing camera.
Enjoy millions of movies, TV programmes, songs, Kindle eBooks, apps and games including Netflix, Facebook, Spotify and more.
